Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: சான்றவர் சான்றாண்மை குன்றின் இருநிலந்தான்தாங்காது மன்னோ பொறை.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: The mighty earth its burthen to sustain must cease, If perfect virtue of the perfect men decrease.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A group of 'Saandravar' (perfected people) are depicted as colossal, Atlas-like figures, literally holding up the world ('Irunilam').
Layered_Composition.Midground: One of these figures shows a sign of faltering or their virtue diminishing ('Saandraanmai Kundrin'). Where their strength lessens, the part of the world they support begins to crack and crumble.
Layered_Composition.Background: The vast cosmic expanse, showing the planet Earth, which is visibly burdened ('Porai') and fracturing under the strain of this moral failing.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: A powerful, literal visualization of the idea that the very stability of the world rests on the unwavering virtue of its most noble people.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The sages as cosmic pillars supporting the Earth is the central metaphor. The cracking Earth symbolizes the consequence of their virtue failing.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: Dramatic, cosmic lighting. The figures of the sages glow with a golden light of virtue. The crack in the Earth emits a dangerous, chaotic red light.

Technical_Cues.Camera: Epic cosmic shot from space, showing the figures holding the planet, focusing on the point of failure.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, cosmic art, with photorealistic textures for the planet and ethereal effects for the figures.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: Strong celestial light sources, with internal light from the sages and destructive light from the crack.
Technical_Cues.Art_Genre: Mythological cosmic art, with a sense of immense scale and weight.

Cultural_Anchors: The foundational role of virtue in cosmic order

Negative_Prompt: small figures, stable earth, happy figures, text artifacts, cartoonish, modern clothing.
